column4: hello all! quick question - i have a machine running some lubuntu version for bitcoin mining. almost everything has been gutted from the version except terminal and essential stuff.  i want to know what speed my P4 is running at.  the command "-sudo cat /proc/cpuinfo" doesnt work, it says no such command. my question is what dependencies do i need to get for that command to work ?
remove the "-" at the beginning. in fact you don't even need sudo. "cat /pro/cpuinfo" is all you need.
what error message do you get?
if you want a minial ubuntu install, install ubuntu-minimal! https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/MinimalCD
first of all, drop the sudo, completely unnecessary.
what happens if you just run "cat"?
what do you get if you run "which cat"?
it didnt do anything. it dropped to the next line in term, and just sat there blank untill i killed it with ctrl c (i waited a couple minutes)
was that when running "cat" or "which cat"?
ok, that's normal (it's what cat does)
your command returned this "-r--r--r-- 1 root root 0 may 15 03:18 /proc/cpuinfo"  lol. was that intended ?
yes. "cat /proc/cpuinfo" should work just fine according to those results.
you're sure you didn't put a / at the very end?
i can do it again and check, one moment..
hey it worked that time! i must have made a typo. thanks for the help. ps, +1 for Darwinism ;)
no problem. typos are very common
